fields.description:
Firefox will send in some cases no request header "If-Modified-Since", in that case Jira will send back status 304 and body.

In {{atlassian-plugins-webresource}} class {{com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.AbstractBatchDownloadableResource}} method *isResourceModified*.

If one of the resources is modified and one is not, {{com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.util.LastModifiedHandler.checkRequest}} set for one resource "response.setStatus(HttpServletResponse.SC_NOT_MODIFIED)" and the method isResourceModified will return true. 

This makes com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.PluginResourceDownload will return the body in the method serveFile. Which must not happen as per [this guide (section 10.3.5)|http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html]
fields.summary: JIRA returns 304 error with message body

fields.description:
h3.Description
I have noticed that in one of our JIRA instances with 70k+ issues, a lot of them have wrong count of watchers which leads to wrong search results (we prioritize some items by amount of watchers because we have voting disabled).

I have verified that the watches count differs from the watchissue user associations in the database and in an XML export. Even after re-importing the XML data, the count gets out of sync with the actual amount of watchers.

After inspecting the JIRA source, the code seems quite stable except for some minor flaws.

I then found that our extensive use of the clone issue operation might have caused the issue and I was able to reproduce this on a JIRA 6.0.6 instance:

!cloning_watch_count_increase.png!

!cloning_watch_count_increase_watchers.png!

Besides fixing the bug in the clone issue operation, it would be good to provide a fix for this (probably a SQL update statement that counts the actual user watchissue associations and updates the count).

Thanks

h3.Steps to produce:
# Create a new issue and make sure you are added as a watcher to the issue (you are the only watcher for this ticket)
# Clone this issue to another issue and make sure that you are added as a watcher for the new cloned issue (you are the only watcher for this ticket)
# Go to the _Issue Navigator_ and add the column *Watchers* to the issue navigator
# You will notice that for the cloned issue, there will be two watchers, and when you try to open the issue, you will only see one user.

h3.Workaround
You can conduct either of the following for workaround:
- Update 'watches' column of 'jiraissue' table and run re-index
- Upgrade JIRA to 6.3.3 or later, which automatically corrects the unsyncronized watchers number

h3.Workaround 2:
If even after the upgrade some issues are still showing the wrong number:
- Run the following SQL query to see if this applies to your case (if it returns any results, you can proceed):
{code:sql}
select * from jiraissue where id not in (select sink_node_id from userassociation where association_type = 'WatchIssue') and watches > 0;
{code}
- Create a backup from your JIRA, just in case ;) ;
- Stop your JIRA;
- Run the following SQL query:
{code:sql}
update jiraissue set watches = 0 where id not in (select sink_node_id from userassociation where association_type = 'WatchIssue') and watches > 0;
{code}
- Start your JIRA;
- Perform a full re-index.

h3. Notes

This upgrade task can take quite some time, especially depending upon the type of database used and also the issue / watch count. In some cases it takes 30+ minutes.
fields.summary: Watch count gets out of sync when cloning issues

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34389].
{panel}
Regression of JRA-4935

When i add the "Reporter" to the "Browse Project" Permission of one project. This project instantly becomes visible to ALL users(via the project table portlet), if they have any kind of permission to see this project or not.

So all users can see this project, but can't see any issues within it. Thats not very good, as we want to keep our customers strictly seperated from one another and we have a lot of projects. That would be very confusing if you see lots of projects in your dashboard, but only one or two of them are relevant to you and the rest is empty.

*Workaround to restrict issue view to Reporter and Browse Project to only a specific group of users:*
If a Project is only relevant to one or several groups
 # Add the related groups to the Role(Users) and remove unrelated groups that shouldn't see the project.
 # Set Create and Browse permissions for Role(Users). (Remove 'Reporter' from Browse Project permission)
 # Use Issue level security to restrict viewing to Reporter
 *Result:* only users in the Role(Users) see the project and Browse only it's own Reported issues.
Step by step instructions to set Security Level at [How to limit user to only browse issues assigned to or reported by them|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/How+to+limit+user+to+only+browse+issues+assigned+to+or+reported+by+them]
fields.summary: Regression - "Browse Project" permission for "Reporter" grants users to see projects they are not permitted to.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding an AppLink, if the manifest.json 404s due to a misconfigured proxy or network issue nothing is displayed in the Add Application Link page.

h3. Environment

* Pound reverse-proxy
* MySQL - 5.1.69
* AppLinks  3.11.0-m8

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure proxy so that it's returning a 404 for the following URL:
http://example.com/jira/rest/applinks/1.0/applicationlinkForm/manifest.json?url=http%3A%2F%2Fexample.com%2Fstash&_=1376535788019
# Attempt to add an application link in Step 1 as per the screenie.

h3. Expected Results

An error is presented to the user with feedback about the problem.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing appears in the browser and the add button no longer works without a page refresh.

h3. Notes

This is caused by a misconfiguration with a proxy or network where the page is being 404'd outside of JIRA. Bug raised as it appears that JIRA is broken and seems like we could handle this better.
fields.summary: Adding an AppLink doesn't proceed past the Server URL (Step 1) page

fields.description:
When converting a Jira 6.0.6 install using HSQL to postgresql using the /bin/config.sh, the dbconfig.xml retained the 
<schema-name>PUBLIC</schema-name>
element. On startup, Jira had an error displayed on the browser that an invalid element associated only with HSQL was present in the dbconfig.xml. I had to shut Jira back down, delete the dbconfig.xml, re-run config.sh and recreate the db connection for a clean/correct dbconfig.xml. So we're up and running, but I wanted to report this as a bug.
fields.summary: When converting from HSQL to Postgresql, the dbconfig.xml retains invalid elements.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34341].
  {panel}

It would be nice that JIRA came with a default "start date" field. Even when you are able to add this as a custom field, you cannot really rely on it being there for every project, and in big organizations that is a problem.

A start date field could be used to implement several useful features that could enable organic collaboration, such as:

- Send an alert to the assignee on the start date if the issue is open/reopened
- Send an alert to the project administrator with X days advance if the issue is unassigned and open/reopened
- Be able to plan with TeamCalendars (due date is not enough, created date is meaningless for planning)
- Be able to implement a Gantt view out of the box
- Be able to do basic capacity planning based on filters that show a dynamic window of time

Planning a start date, even if it is just a guess, is a vital piece of information for project management.
fields.summary: As a project administrator, I'd like to be able to set a start date for my issues

  Locked ownable synchronizers:
- locked <368c02dd> (a java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker)
{code}

h4. Cause
There may be a concurrency problem in the way we use Rhino in the LESS compiler, such that is it very blocky/slow under concurrent load.

The results of LESS compilation are cached. But the cache is cleared (for example) when installing a plugin. At that point, concurrent calls to (different) CSS batches cause many threads to be concurrently entering the LESS compiler.
fields.summary: Under high concurrent load, LESS compiler performs terribly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing a project, issue status ids are mapped from the old IDs to new IDs based on the issue status names.
This leads to the Agile _Burndown_, _Cumulative Flow Diagram_ charts becoming wrong, as the change history entries are referring to different or nonexistent issue statuses.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Source JIRA with <STATE> and do multiple transitions.
# Make xml backup.
# Import xml backup into Target JIRA
# Check {{changeitem}} table _oldvalue_ and _newvalue_ values

h3. Expected Results
The change history oldvalue and newvalue fields are update to match Target JIRA. 

h3. Actual Results
When this is done, the change history oldvalue and newvalue fields are not updated.
 
h3. Notes
I can see two ways of fixing this:
* a. Change Agile to look at {{changeitem.oldstring}} and {{changeitem.newstring}} instead of {{changeitem.oldvalue}} and {{changeitem.newvalue}} when it's determining status change history
* b. Change the project import process to do the equivalent of:
{code}
update changeitem set newvalue=(select id from issuestatus where pname=changeitem.newstring) and field='status' and fieldtype='jira' and groupid in (select id from changegroup where issueid in (select id from jiraissue where project = :projectid));
update changeitem set oldvalue=(select id from issuestatus where pname=changeitem.oldstring) and field='status' and fieldtype='jira' and groupid in (select id from changegroup where issueid in (select id from jiraissue where project = :projectid));
{code}

h3.Workaround
Update DB table {{changeitem}} manually for each state: <STATE> .
{code}
UPDATE changeitem
SET oldvalue = '<TARGET_STATE_ID>'
WHERE fieldtype = 'jira'
  AND FIELD = 'status'
  AND oldvalue = '<SOURCE_STATE_ID>'
  AND oldstring LIKE "<STATE>%"

UPDATE changeitem
SET newvalue = '<TARGET_STATE_ID>'
WHERE fieldtype = 'jira'
  AND FIELD = 'status'
  AND newvalue = '<SOURCE_STATE_ID>'
  AND newstring LIKE "<STATE>%"
{code}
fields.summary: Importing individual projects from an XML backup can lead to Agile charts being wrong.
History searches do not support the 'project' field.
View Projects in System Default Field Configuration "Scheme"
Separate Custom Field management permission
Revision cache size not saving configuration
Add the ability to change the project type after the project creation.

fields.description:
If we create an Issue by mail and the project have a Post Function to add a specific person to be the watcher, this will be ignored by JIRA since it's considering the user as an anonymous user. 
Also, the user who is creating the issue have the Manage Watchers permission. If he creates the issue by the UI, it works properly.

*Workaround:* 
- Set the Manage Watchers permission to the "Anyone" group, but this is not recommended since it will give anyone the rights to manage watchers.
fields.summary: Create Issue by mail is not respecting the Manage Watchers permission
Assign existing created filters in the activity stream

fields.description:
From the non fixed :
JRA-34325
JRA-4588

Unable to rename user from local directory
fields.summary: Unable to rename user from local directory

fields.description:
Here is the step to reproduce the issue: 
# Install a fresh JIRA 6 instance. 
# Create a second "user1@test" then rename it to "user1".
# Create a new issue security scheme with one security level limited to admin user and "user1".
# Create a new project and one issue with the security level. 
# Logout and login with the account "user1" then open the issue. 
# The Permission violation page shows up.

*Please note that the issue only affected the security level or project permission created after user renamed.*

*As a temporary workaround solution:* It is possible to create a customfield with type of user picker and associate with the issue security / project permission, then add the user name in the customfield.  As only the user who got the edit issue permission can edit the field.
fields.summary: Issue security / Project permission check failed after user renamed on JIRA 6

fields.description:
Cannot edit any of the external gadget on dashboard. Editing form element doesn't show up when selecting "Edit" from external gadget's Gadget Menu.

This issue may be different from [JRA-34274|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34274] as it doesn't have any JS exceptions.

A little bit debugging and it turned out that form has unwanted "hidden" class defined. Show/hide toggle is managed with css display: block/none. But "hidden" class is more important and form stays hidden.

At the moment the template that I can see from browser resources is:
{code:html|title=/secure/Dashboard.jspa line 634}
<form action="${userPrefs.action}" class="aui userpref-form hidden" method="post" id="gadget-${id}-edit">
{code}

But should be without hidden class:
{code:html|title=/secure/Dashboard.jspa line 634}
<form action="${userPrefs.action}" class="aui userpref-form" method="post" id="gadget-${id}-edit">
{code}

For example on dashboard:
-> "+ Add gadget"
-> find "JIRA: News"
-> "Add it now"
-> "Close" dialog
-> Open "Gadget Menu" dropdown from gadget upper right corner
-> "Edit"
fields.summary: Dashboard external gadgets cannot be edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34323].
  {panel}

This is on configuring Application Link between JIRA and Confluence via HTTPS.

Encountered the issue with BAD URL Signature recently on both JIRA and Confluence where the two instances connecting to each other over SSL (HTTPS). 

There has been a KB article on this in the following explaining the cause
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Application+Link+authentication+fails+due+to+bad+URL+signature

I'm requesting to include the above KB article link to both of the following documentations with a warning if the user is on reverse proxy (or simply, using domain name instead of IP address to access JIRA/Confluence):
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+LDAP+or+JIRA+or+Other+Services+via+SSL
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+SSL+services

There is also suggestion to have the two parameters (as follows) to be in {{server.xml}} by default (included in the _Connector port_ for SSL)  so that all customer would need to configure this when trying to configure SSL services.
{noformat}proxyName
proxyPort{noformat}
fields.summary: Update documentation on connecting to other SSL services

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the default membership for project roles will only apply to new projects and will not affect existing projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to update existing projects so that default members of roles can be retrospectively added to existing projects.
 
h3. Workaround
Manually update each existing project with any new users for the specific project roles.
fields.summary: Enhance default membership for project role so that it can push changes to the defaults to existing projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34318].
  {panel}

When using the action menu (period) after opening up an issue, the issue reverts to the top of the window, unless you click and point focus somewhere else.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open any case without focus (no direct link to comment. Also helps if case has enough content to necessitate scrolling down to see bottom of issue).
2. Scroll to bottom without clicking anywhere on the issue
3. Bring up action menu using period shortcut
4. Note that the screen jumps to the top of issue or up to top of comments section
5. Next, scroll to bottom of issue. 
6. Click and put focus on the last comment on the issue.
7. Now hit action menu and note that position of the screen stays at bottom of the issue.

Expected results:
When scrolling to the bottom of an issue, without clicking to put focus down there, bringing up action menu does not move the screen back to the top. I reference the last comment in my next bounce and having to constantly ensure my focus is down on the last comment is tiresome. 

Please let me know if more details are necessary.
Chrome 28 exhibits behavior. Firefox 22 does not.
fields.summary: Bringing up action menu using period moves screen focus

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34300].
  {panel}

When you do a search like: level = xxxx using advanced search in JIRA's issue navigator (in the case whereby the xxxx security level actually exists but the user doesn't belong to this security level, and therefore cannot see this issues). JIRA returns the following message: "The value 'xxxx' does not exist for the field 'level".

This could offer certain security in-case where certain users are not supposed to know about the existence of such level. But generally this can be very misleading, especially to JIRA Admins. 

A more accurate and yet secure error message may be something like: 
{noformat}"The value 'xxxx' does not exist for the field 'level' or you do not have required permission"{noformat}... This might also remind JIRA admins to add themselves to the security level, even if only temporarily before they run queries like that.
fields.summary: Advanced search for issues belonging to a level, give misleading error if the user doesn't belong to the level

fields.description:
Link to JIRA from exported Word document fails because URL contains special characters: '?' and '=' which does not convert properly in browser.

Steps:
* Open a JIRA issue with comments on the ticket.
* Click on the Views button at top right, and select Word.
* Click Open button on "Open or Save?" dialog.
* In the Word file, CTRL-Click on the "username" link in the comment section.

An error page is displayed:
{code}
Not Found (404)
/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa%3Fname=username
Could not find what you were looking for. Maybe you should raise an issue.
JIRA home
{code}

If I change the '%3F' to '?' and '%3D' to '=' in the URL, the correct page is displayed.

Link from Word document has: https://<server>/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=username

Page tries to load as: https://<server>/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa%3Fname%3Dusername

Similar to issue reported on JRA-32803 which was fixed on 5.2.11, but we are currently running 5.2.11 version.
fields.summary: Unable to navigate to JIRA from exported Word document due to special characters in URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34284].
  {panel}

Currently, when assigning custom field, we have two contexts to which a custom field can be assigned:

* Global context. Apply to all issues in JIRA.
* Apply to issues under selected projects

This is good when you want to apply a custom field to every projects or a limited number of project.

However, when a project come which do not want a specific custom field, there is no easy solution to exclude said field.

You could
* Create series of specific screens for that project that hide the custom field
* In the custom field configuration, slect every other projects except the one you don't want the field in. 

The first solution could lead to the creation of many duplicated screens with only a single field changed, leading to more maintenance cost when adding global fields in the future.

The second also add to maintenance cost (and risk) by having to go add every new project that need the custom field in the future.

Thus, I would like to add a 3rd feature:
* Exclude this field to issues under selected projects

Any project selected would see the custom field excluded.

It would save maintenance and ensure field aren't forgotten when dealing with special custom fields.
fields.summary: Ability to exclude custom field per project in custom field configuration
